paper_abstract: Let P-n(x) = x(m) + p(m-1)(n)x(m-1)+ . . . + p(1)(n)x + p(m)(n) be a parametrized family of polynomials of a given degree with complex coefficients P-k(n) depending on a parameter n epsilon Z(>= 0). We use Rouche's theorem to obtain approximations to the complex roots of P-n(x). As an example, we obtain approximations to the complex roots of the quintic polynomials P-n(x) = x(5) + nx(4) - (2n + 1)x(3) + (n + 2)x(2) - 2x + 1 studied by A. M. Schopp. (c) 2007 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Localization of the complex zeros of parametrized families of polynomials
